column4: does anyone have an idea why I can't GPG sign files from nautilus but i can from the command line?
you may beable to (for the most part everything can be done either cli or gui) but i dont know how
i can do it from the command line, but it's convenient from nautilus
you can do it from both just not sure how
in nautilus there is a Sign option when you right click a file...it asks me for my passcode but then does not create the detached signature
were almost past flight 6 give it a few more days and install the beta
cool, i'm running breezy now...do i change my apt sources to say flight6 or dapper?  if i change to dapper now, i will continue to get upgrades until the final release, right?
thanks
i would wait until 20th
oh ya? lots of bug fixes then?
if you use the first link use dapper instead of breezy
it will be more for communtiy use than
alrighty
i followed the instructions for the upgrade in the link you supplied, but the update-manager doesn't offer me the option to upgrade to dapper
what am i missing?  should i just change it in the apt source file and dist-upgrade?
you can run them both on same system
cool...but i don't really want to...i want to force the user to use xfce...would i remove ubuntu-desktop after?
not htat easy
install xubuntu-desktop set it to the default
alrighty...how do i set the default?  in gdm.conf?
in the gdm when you are chooseing the desktop you want to use choose xfce and it will ask you to make default
click make default
cool no prob
thanks for the help
